title: Guardians of a Space National Guard
description: With NASA's Artemis moon landing delayed to no earlier than 2025, will Congress vote to create a separate Space National Guard?

title: Eyes Everywhere: Intelligence and Strategic Decisionmaking in the Gray Zone
description: The United States must improve its ability to counter the kind of “gray zone” tactics favored by China and Russia. A recent CSIS tabletop exercise gave some insight into how Washington can improve its competitive edge.

title: UK-France Defense and Security Relations Need a Reboot
description: After years of Brexit turmoil, UK-France relations have reached a low point after the recent spats over AUKUS and fishing licenses. Paris and London should recall the history and significance of their friendship to help reboot their defense and security relationship.

title: Spotlight - Malaysia: November 23, 2021
description: On October 4, the state legislative assembly of Melaka in the south of Malaysia was dissolved and the United Malays National Organisation (UMNO)-led government collapsed after four members of the assembly, including two members of UMNO, withdrew their support for the chief...

title: Trade Laws of Nature: Biodiversity Provisions and the AfCFTA
description: Adding biodiversity provisions to the AfCFTA could help facilitate the responsible trade of biodiversity-based products and boost environmental protection. A new CQ from the Scholl Chair explores.

title: An Olive's Odyssey
description: In Syria’s north-west provinces, a different kind of oil drives the wartime economy—olive oil—as Afrin's olive farmers struggle for economic survival in the midst of the conflict.

title: Where’s the Beef?
description: In this week's column, the Scholl Chair comments on Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo and USTR Katherine Tai's new partnerships in the Asia and Indo-Pacific regions.

title: Haitian Migration: Food Insecurity, Fragility, and a Better Way Forward
description: Recent coverage of Haitians arriving at the U.S. border is only a snapshot of a years-long journey in search of safety and food security. U.S. strategy toward Haiti must consider the links between hunger and migration and prioritize food security as a pillar of stability.

title: Prime Minister Modi and Myanmar’s Military Junta
description: Is India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi a friend or foe of Myanmar’s military junta? Modi has several reasons why he may want to maintain friendly relations with the junta, but siding with the SAC is not without its risks.

title: The End of History in the Middle East
description: Dr. Jon Alterman discusses contrasting views of a new kind of authoritarianism in the Middle East.

title: China: The Growing Military Challenge: Volume Two of a Graphic Net Assessment
description: China focuses on key military developments to achieve its strategic goals without a major conflict and without the direct use of military force, writes CSIS’s Emeritus Chair in Strategy.

title: Maritime Security Dialogue: The Aegis Approach with Rear Admiral Tom Druggan
description: Join the International Security Program for a Maritime Security Dialogue event featuring Rear Admiral Tom Druggan, Program Executive, Aegis Ballistic Missile Defense, Missile Defense Agency and Dr. Tom Karako.
